ADDICTION.Defintion: an inability to stop doing or using something, especially something harmful

AMATEUR.Defintion: taking part in an activity for pleasure, not as a job

AUTHORITATIVE.Defintion: containing complete and accurate information, and therefore respected

BILLIARD.Defintion: used in or relating to billiards (= a game played by two people on a table covered in green cloth, in which a long stick is used to hit balls into pockets around the table)

BILLIARDS.Defintion: a game played by two people on a table covered in green cloth, in which a long stick is used to hit balls into pockets around the table

BIODEGRADE.Defintion: to decay naturally and in a way that is not harmful

BOOM.Defintion: a period of sudden economic growth, especially one that results in a lot of money being made

COMB.Defintion: a flat piece of plastic, wood, or metal with a thin row of long, narrow parts along one side, used to tidy and arrange your hair

COMBS.Defintion: a flat piece of plastic, wood, or metal with a thin row of long, narrow parts along one side, used to tidy and arrange your hair

CONSEQUENCES.Defintion: a result of a particular action or situation, often one that is bad or not convenient

COUNTLESS.Defintion: very many, or too many to be counted

DISPOSE.Defintion: to get rid of something; throw out or destroy

DWARFED.Defintion: If one thing dwarfs another, it makes it seem small by comparison

HYDROCARBONS.Defintion: a chemical combination of hydrogen and carbon, such as in oil or petrol

INITIATIVES.Defintion: a new plan or process to achieve something or solve a problem

IVORY.Defintion: the hard yellowish-white substance that forms the tusks of some animals such as elephants, used especially in the past to make decorative objects

NAPPIES.Defintion: a square of thick soft paper or cloth that is fastened around a baby's bottom and between its legs to absorb its urine and solid waste

NAPPY.Defintion: a square of thick soft paper or cloth that is fastened around a baby's bottom and between its legs to absorb its urine and solid waste

OUT OF THE GOODNESS OF THEIR OWN HEART.Defintion: out of personal generosity and not because he or she wanted to get anything for himself or herself

POLYMER.Defintion: a chemical substance consisting of large molecules made from many smaller and simpler molecules

POOL.Defintion: a game in which two people use cues (= long, thin poles) to hit 16 coloured balls into six holes around the edge of a large table covered in soft cloth

RUBBISH DUMPS.Defintion: places where rubbish is left, disposed of

SCARCE.Defintion: not easy to find or get

THE RAW MATERIALS.Defintion: any material, such as oil, cotton, or sugar in its natural condition, before it has been processed for use

TRIAL AND ERROR.Defintion: a way of achieving an aim or solving a problem by trying a number of different methods and learning from the mistakes that you make

TRIALING.Defintion: testing, usually over a limited period of time, to discover how effective or suitable something or someone is

TUSKS.Defintion: either of the two long, pointed teeth of some animals such as elephants

VERSATILE.Defintion: able to change easily from one activity to another or able to be used for many different purposes
